response:
A young woman with an apparently subacute isolated cerebellar syndrome most likely has an inflammatory or demyelinating lesion, with structural, immune, metabolic, toxic, hereditary, and paraneoplastic causes also needing exclusion.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple sclerosis with cerebellar plaque", "Autoimmune cerebellar ataxia associated with anti-GAD antibodies", "Cerebellar tumour (e.g., low-grade astrocytoma or hemangioblastoma)", "Ischaemic cerebellar stroke (posterior inferior cerebellar artery or superior cerebellar artery territory)", "Gluten-related cerebellar ataxia secondary to coeliac disease", "Drug- or toxin-induced cerebellar degeneration (e.g., alcohol, phenytoin, lithium)", "Hereditary spinocerebellar ataxia", "Paraneoplastic cerebellar degeneration", "Nutritional or metabolic cerebellar degeneration (vitamin B1 deficiency, vitamin B12 deficiency, vitamin E deficiency, hypothyroidism)"]
